result.execSummary:
The defendant Jay R Brussveen was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manuf/Deliver Amphetamine(<=3g) [Modifiers: Conspiracy to Commit], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(e)1.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: If probation is revoked or will discharge with outstanding financial obligations due, a civil judgment shall be entered for the balance due.  Any bond on hand will be applied towards costs.
Submit DNA sample.   AODA and comply.

Defendant Jay R Brussveen in court, in custody with attorney Ryan T. Frank.  Jane E. Kohlwey appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Rights/Elements.  Defendant pled no contest.  Court found guilty.  Judgment was entered.  Court withheld sentencing, placed defendant on probation for 2 years.  Conditions of probation inlcude:  Submit DNA sample.  $518.00 costs.  AODA and comply.  30 days jail, with Huber.  Forthwith (at request of defendant and Atty Frank).  15 days credit.  Bond on hand to be applied towards costs.
Plea/sentencing hearing on April 12, 2016 at 02:45 pm.
